definition: variant of 姿勢|姿势[zi1 shi4]

sentences.english: Have him shift his lower body into a half-kneeling position, entering you from behind.
sentences.chinese: 讓他扭轉他的下體成半跪姿式，從後面插入。

sentences.english: Try to keep a tall natural posture without slouching.
sentences.chinese: 儘量保持上體自然的姿式。

sentences.english: It's impossible to get in a comfortable resting position.
sentences.chinese: 簡直是沒辦法找到一個舒服的休息姿式。

sentences.english: The most effective way to walk is the natural way. Keep your head high and your back straight .
sentences.chinese: 自然地行走是最有效的步行，要保持擡頭挺胸的姿式。

sentences.english: These fishes are soon able to hold themselves in a vertical position.
sentences.chinese: 這些魚類不久便能保持直立的姿式。

sentences.english: Some even argue that squatting is a more natural position for 1) urination and 2) well, number two.
sentences.chinese: 一些人甚至說對撒尿來說蹲姿是一種更自然的姿式。

sentences.english: The so-called best part of it is that those who expressed their willingness to listen to each other greeting speech posture.
sentences.chinese: 所謂最佳部位是指問候者表示願意聽對方講話的姿式。

sentences.english: An act or a gesture of welcome, honor, or courteous recognition.
sentences.chinese: 表示歡迎，尊敬或禮貌認可的行爲或姿式。

sentences.english: So, to master the correct posture is very important.
sentences.chinese: 所以掌握正確的姿式十分重要。

sentences.english: A description of her figure and her walking would have won her any praise.
sentences.chinese: 對她的體形和走路姿式無論怎麼誇獎也不過分。

sentences.english: Thee most effective way to walk is the natural way. Keep your head high and your back straight .
sentences.chinese: 自然地行走是最有效的步行，要保持擡頭挺胸的姿式。

definition: gesture/same as 手勢|手势[shou3 shi4]
to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
to bow/to bend at the waist
T-step (basic dance position, with the feet forming a T shape)
to sit cross-legged/to sit in the lotus position
to straighten one's back/to arch one's back
